intro: Peristylus stenostachyus, commonly known as the narrow-stalked peristylus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
